title: Rogelio Domínguez
text:
Rogelio Antonio Domínguez López (9 March 1931 – 23 July 2004) was an <a href="Argentina">Argentine</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="goalkeeper%20%28football%29">goalkeeper</a> who played for <a href="Real%20Madrid%20C.F.">Real Madrid</a> and was part of their <a href="UEFA%20Champions%20League">European Cup</a> victories in <a href="European%20Cup%201958-59">1959</a> and <a href="European%20Cup%201959-60">1960</a>. He was in <a href="Argentina%20national%20football%20team">Argentina</a>'s squad for the <a href="1962%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1962 FIFA World Cup</a>.
Biography.
Domínguez was discovered during a match by the cofounder of the famous Club <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20River%20Plate">River Plate</a>, <a href="Carlos%20Peucelle">Carlos Peucelle</a>, who persuaded Dominguez to begin to train at <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20River%20Plate">River Plate</a> in March 1946. He was seventeen years old when he was discovered by delegates of the <a href="Racing%20Club%20de%20Avellaneda">Racing Club</a> of <a href="Avellaneda">Avellaneda</a> and he was signed immediately.
In 1957 Domínguez signed for <a href="Real%20Madrid%20C.F.">Real Madrid</a> in Spain. After several successful seasons with the club, he returned to South America where he played for <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20River%20Plate">River Plate</a> and <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20V%C3%A9lez%20Sarsfield">Vélez Sarsfield</a> in Argentina, and then <a href="CA%20Cerro">CA Cerro</a>, <a href="Club%20Nacional%20de%20Football">Nacional</a> in Uruguay and <a href="Clube%20de%20Regatas%20do%20Flamengo">Flamengo</a> in Brazil.
International career.
In 1951 he won the <a href="Panamerican%20Championship">Panamerican Championship</a> playing for the <a href="Argentina%20national%20football%20team">Argentina national football team</a>; to which he'd belonged for 12 years, from 1951 to 1963. He was chosen Best America's Goalkeeper for two consecutive seasons, in 1956 and 1957 and was part of the triumphant team that claimed the 1957 <a href="Copa%20Am%C3%A9rica">Copa América</a> title.
After playing.
After 20 years at the top of worldwide <a href="association%20football">football</a> he quit playing at the age of forty in 1970 and become manager of <a href="San%20Lorenzo%20de%20Almagro">San Lorenzo</a>, <a href="Argentina">Argentine</a> National Sub-champion in 1971, <a href="Chacarita%20Juniors">Chacarita Juniors</a> (1972), <a href="Boca%20Juniors">Boca Juniors</a> (1973–1975) and many other clubs including <a href="Club%20de%20Gimnasia%20y%20Esgrima%20La%20Plata">Gimnasia de La Plata</a>, <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Tucum%C3%A1n">Club Atlético Tucumán</a>, <a href="Loma%20Negra%20de%20Olavarr%C3%ADa">Loma Negra</a>, <a href="Quilmes%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Club">Quilmes</a> and <a href="Racing%20Club%20de%20Avellaneda">Racing Club</a>.
Domínguez died of a heart attack on 23 July 2004 in the <a href="Hospital%20Penna">Hospital Penna</a> of the <a href="Las%20Flores%2C%20Buenos%20Aires">Flores</a> district of Buenos Aires.
